intro: Torilis anthriscus subsp. ucranica, commonly known as the Ukrainian cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-shaped clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is native to regions of Eastern Europe, including Ukraine. It is often found in meadows, along riverbanks, and in disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
